programme.title: Top Gear

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Motoring madness. James learns why the Finns are such good racing drivers, Richard tests the outlandish Veritas sports car, and film star Mark Wahlberg guests.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Pickin' for the Fences: Mike and Frank uncover a baseball in Oklahoma that has been signed by one of the greatest players of all time.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Best Of: Deep Woods Pickin': Mike and Frank venture off the beaten path in hopes of finding deals and profit on the road less travelled.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Coastal Escape
programme.desc: Aeolian Islands: Gino is on the Aeolian islands of Salina and Panarea to discover what they contribute to the Italian kitchen and what keeps Robert De Niro coming back to the area.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Coastal Escape
programme.desc: Venice and Burano: Gino begins his epic journey in Venice - where he tours its waterways with one of the city's youngest gondoliers - before heading to Burano for a lesson in lace-making.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Coastal Escape
programme.desc: Ravenna and San Marino: Gino heads south along the Adriatic to visit two UNESCO sites this time - one is the beautiful town of Ravenna, and the other is the Republic of San Marino.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Coastal Escape

programme.title: Motorhoming with Merton and Webster

programme.desc: Pansexual Sarah can't wait to road test her new body on her first date as a woman. Plumber Jamie's love life has gone down the u-bend, so he's all cisterns go to find a partner.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Pansexual sex therapist Mariia's after a not-so-average Mr or Mrs who's not too tired for sex. Old romantic at heart Alannah seeks a forever fella who can speak her love language.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the 'Box this time: Strictly Come Dancing, Sex Education, Blankety Blank, Bake Off, Celebrity Race Across the World, Love & Death, Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins, and Ambulance.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Spuds: Phil and Claire take Haley and Dylan to dinner to reassure them they're not bad parents. Mitch and Cam chaperone Lily's first date. Jay and Gloria go to Joe's school play.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Abusive Abe twists the narrative, but Mercedes will do whatever it takes to stop him. Elsewhere, a deadly threat has Grace pointing fingers, and the flame is reignited for a former couple.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Just as it looks like abuser Abe has the upper hand, a strong alliance is formed. Meanwhile, a heartfelt apology has damning consequences, and Dillon is offered a safe space.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Mercedes is determined to do whatever it takes to stop Abe. Elsewhere, flames are reignited for one former couple, but will their family be supportive?

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister, Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sports of the lawnmower, motorbike and bicycle variety.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits four restaurants he tried to help: the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, and Kingston Café, La Frite and Capri in California.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Favor: Mobster Seamus Murphy returns to redeem the favour Holt owes him for helping to get Diaz and Peralta out of jail, so the team search for a loophole.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Safe House: After mobster Seamus Murphy threatens Kevin, Captain Holt devises an elaborate plan to hide his husband in a safe house, with Peralta as his guard.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Financial Secret and Fish Sauce: George Sr asks Sheldon to keep a secret from Mary, but the stress of not being honest drives Sheldon to hide at Tam's house.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Research Study and Czechoslovakian Wedding Pastries: Dr Sturgis recommends Sheldon and Missy for a university research study on twins, but Mary is unhappy.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Spaghetti Catalyst: Sheldon hides his friendship with Penny from Leonard, but it isn't long before his double life is exposed. Can he remain friends with both of them?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Plimpton Stimulation: When Sheldon meets a famous physicist online, he invites her over to the apartment, where she spends her time flirting with Leonard.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Weathering Heights: Phil's excited when he's invited on the local news. And his day gets even better when he meets his weatherman hero, Rainer Shine (guest star Nathan Fillion).

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Halloween 4: The Revenge of Rod Skyhook: Luke's Halloween party looks bad. The Dunphys decide it needs is a visit from Rod Skyhook, a little promotion and some adult supervision...

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Dead on a Rival: Mitchell learns a valuable life lesson when Murray shows up unexpectedly. And the Dunphys' old neighbour Kenneth, who's now a tech titan, visits.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Convention Conundrum: After the guys miss out on Comic-Con tickets, Sheldon decides to hold his own comic book convention. The girls take tea at a swanky hotel.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Locomotive Manipulation: Love is in the air when Amy convinces Sheldon to join her for a romantic train trip to Napa Valley to celebrate Valentine's Day.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Table Polarization: Leonard buys a dining table for the flat but Sheldon objects to such a big change inside his home. Meanwhile, Howard gets the chance to return to space.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: David, Goliath and a Yoo-Hoo from the Back: Sheldon uses his new friendship with the school bully to boss Georgie around. Missy steals Meemaw's make-up.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Math Emergency and Perky Palms: Sheldon and Dr Sturgis fall out when Dr Sturgis marks a question as wrong on Sheldon's test paper. And Mary takes over Pastor Jeff's duties.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Heavy Is the Head: Will Phil have to rethink his property dream? And Cam has to go to hospital but refuses to have an MRI scan because of a traumatic childhood incident in a well.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Finding Fizbo: Cam is enraged when he sees a clip of someone desecrating his beloved Fizbo costume, so he sets out on a quest to restore Fizbo's good name.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Haw-Haw Land: Nelson goes all-out to impress Lisa when she falls for the talented new boy at school. And Bart takes up chemistry - but to what end?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Frink Gets Testy: When Mr Burns panics about the apocalypse and builds a cosmic ark, Professor Frink develops a test to work out who deserves a place on it.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Focus Attenuation: The guys attempt to invent something of scientific importance but only come up with new and enjoyable ways to procrastinate.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Expedition Approximation: Sheldon and Raj try to find out if they could survive a dark-matter research expedition in a salt mine by simulating the conditions in a tunnel.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Misinterpretation Agitation: A smitten doctor turns up at Penny's door after her flirtatious sales techniques for the pharmaceutical company work a little too well.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad Marge: Otto's rock 'n' roll marriage to his girlfriend Becky (Parker Posey) is over as soon as it's begun. So Becky moves in with the Simpsons.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: There's a party at The Hutch as the restaurant re-opens its doors, but the cheer turns to fear when an unexpected guest crashes the celebrations. And Martha jeopardises her family secrets.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Dead on a Rival: Mitchell learns a valuable life lesson when Murray shows up unexpectedly. And the Dunphys' old neighbour Kenneth, who's now a tech titan, visits.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Flanders' Ladder: Bart is struck by lightning and has horrible dreams. Maude Flanders returns to seek revenge.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Clown in the Dumps: Krusty loses confidence and retires from showbusiness after his father dies without ever giving approval to his career. Lisa frets about Homer's health.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Some of Britain's best-loved celebs, including Chris Eubank, Mel C, Olly Alexander and Vic Reeves, have been watching Dragons' Den, Extreme Sisters and lots of other great TV.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers watch Michael McIntyre's The Wheel, Love Is Blind, Strictly Come Dancing, Boiling Point, HELP! My House Is Haunted, and All Creatures Great and Small.

programme.title: Assassin Club
programme.desc: (2023) Action with Henry Golding and Sam Neill. An assassin wants to retire for love, but his handler has entered him into a deadly game of hit the hitman. Can he survive to live his dream?

programme.title: Terminator: Dark Fate
programme.desc: (2019) Sci-fi action sequel with Linda Hamilton and Arnold Schwarzenegger. A factory worker is targeted by deadly robot assassins from the future. Thank goodness he's back.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Babe: Pig in the City
programme.desc: (1998) Charming family comedy sequel. The farm's in trouble and only a sheep-herding pig can save the day. But after a customs mix-up, Babe ends up in a boarding house for lost animals...

programme.title: Anastasia
programme.desc: (1997) Animated drama. When the Russian royal family is murdered, the sole surviving child is separated from her grandmother. Years later, conmen try to exploit the reward for her return.

programme.title: The Perfect Catch
programme.desc: (2005) Comedy. Ben (Jimmy Fallon) must choose between his two loves: Lindsey (Drew Barrymore) and the Boston Red Sox baseball team. Based on Nick Hornby's novel Fever Pitch.

programme.title: Puss in Boots
programme.desc: (2011) In an animated adventure set long before he meets his future companion Shrek, the swashbuckling ginger cat Puss in Boots sets out to steal golden eggs from a giant's castle.

programme.title: We Live in Time Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Andrew Garfield and Florence Pugh - along with director John Crowley - talk about making the Film4-backed romantic drama We Live in Time.

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
programme.desc: (2017) Fantasy adventure sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black. Four teenagers are sucked into the Jumanji video game to complete a dangerous quest.

programme.title: Jumanji: The Next Level
programme.desc: (2019) Adventure comedy sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Jack Black, Kevin Hart and Karen Gillan. The old school pals enter the Jumanji video game again to save their friend.

programme.title: The Night House
programme.desc: (2020) Supernatural horror with Rebecca Hall. A woman starts to think her dead husband is haunting her as she wrestles with her grief in the isolated lakeside house he built for them.

programme.title: The Rider
programme.desc: (2017) Contemporary western from director Chloé Zhao. A cast of non-professional Native American actors play fictionalised versions of themselves on a Sioux reservation in South Dakota.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Annie
programme.desc: (2014) Jamie Foxx stars in this reboot of the 1982 musical. Orphan Annie is transported to post-2008 recession-hit New York, where she becomes the ward of a germaphobe running for mayor.

programme.title: Oliver!
programme.desc: (1968) Carol Reed's evergreen musical based on Charles Dickens' Oliver Twist, with Mark Lester starring as the young orphan in Victorian London. With Ron Moody and Oliver Reed.

programme.title: The Straight Story
programme.desc: (1999) In tribute to auteur David Lynch, who died on 15 January. Singular road-trip drama about a man who crosses America on a lawnmower to visit his dying brother. With Richard Farnsworth.

programme.title: A Knight's Tale
programme.desc: (2001) Modern swashbuckling medieval action adventure starring Heath Ledger, Shannyn Sossamon and Paul Bettany. A lowly squire jousts his way to the top, with help from Geoffrey Chaucer.

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of...
programme.desc: ...Doom: (1984) Harrison Ford returns as the man with a whip in Spielberg's action adventure. Indy heads to India to find a mystical stone that a sinister cult have stolen from a village.

programme.title: The Vanishing
programme.desc: (2018) Gerard Butler and Peter Mullan star in Kristoffer Nyholm's tense thriller based on a true story. Three lighthouse keepers mysteriously disappear after finding a chest of gold bars.

programme.title: My Beautiful Laundrette
programme.desc: (1985) Stephen Frears' comedy-drama starring Saeed Jaffrey and Daniel Day-Lewis. An Asian Londoner gets help setting up a glam laundromat by his lover, a one-time fascist.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: (1954) Crime-comedy starring Alec Guinness. A priest is tasked with accompanying a priceless religious artifact from London to Rome. But the prolific thief Flambeau is hot on his trail...

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: (1958) Western. Van Heflin stars as a veteran frontiersman whose determination to mould his sons in his gun-totin' image backfires disastrously. With Tab Hunter and James Darren

programme.title: Pool of London
programme.desc: (1951) Classic Ealing thriller filmed in a documentary style, starring Bonar Colleano as a sailor whose smuggling activities lead to him being suspected of murder and going on the run.

programme.title: El Dorado
programme.desc: (1966) John Wayne and Robert Mitchum star in Howard Hawks's western. In El Dorado, a gunfighter and a sheriff help protect a rancher from a rival landowner.

programme.title: The Iron Lady
programme.desc: (2011) Meryl Streep's Oscar-winning portrayal of Margaret Thatcher's rise from modest beginnings to her groundbreaking role as Britain's first female Prime Minister. With Jim Broadbent.

programme.title: Deadpool 2

programme.title: Fire Island
programme.desc: (2022) Joel Kim Booster's romcom based on Jane's Austen's Pride and Prejudice. A group of gay friends go on their annual hedonistic jaunt to an idyllic resort. Is it their last hurrah?

programme.title: Venom: Let There Be Carnage
programme.desc: (2021) Tom Hardy returns as Marvel's gnarly antihero, to face a symbiote spawned from Venom's own blood living inside a serial killer who looks just like Woody Harrelson. Yikes.

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: Eight unsuspecting men are nominated by their long-suffering girlfriends to take part in a relationship bootcamp, but the women are sent undercover to spy on them

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Game of words, hosted by Adil Ray, where three pairs of contestants face Lingo grids, fiendish puzzlewords, and a tense head-to-head round as they battle to reach the final and a chance to win a 15,000-pound jackpot. Crossing words to beat the reigning champions this time are sisters Lauren and Ellie from Solihull and friends Gill and Sue

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as Amy gets her chance to take on the Banker. Will she choose to take an offer from the Banker in exchange for what's in her box, or will she bravely hold out until the end and be rewarded?

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the 10 remaining couples compete in movie week, performing routines inspired by beloved films in hope of impressing judges Ashley Banjo, Oti Mabuse, Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean and avoiding elimination. Plus, the skating professionals perform a routine inspired by Wicked

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined at Manor Farm by stars of Father Brown Claudie Blakley and John Burton who share news about the new season; and Hi-de-Hi! star Jeffrey Holland chats about his new autobiography. Farmer Charlie Dodd brings her sheep to the farm to find out if they're expecting in the spring and beer sommelier Marverine Cole continues her hunt to discover Britain's most innovative microbreweries

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef invites Gary Kemp, Sami Tamimi and Francesco Mazzei into his own home, as he hosts a weekend chat show combining his love of food, the great outdoors and fast cars. Includes inspirational recipes, entertainment news and off-road racing challenges

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley journeys through the vibrant and diverse cuisine of West Africa, starting with a spicy West African chicken and peanut stew before Ruby Bhogal goes to Brixton to meet Ibs, find out about jollof rice, and cook up her own West African dish in the form of Ghanaian kelewele. Ore Oduba then joins Ainsley to make beef suya - a dish with fond memories - before Ainsley finishes off with a sweet treat of bofrot puff puffs

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Sandown
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of five races, including the Scilly Isles' Novices' Chase, from Sandown Park, plus the Irish Gold Cup at Leopardstown and action from Musselburgh. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald and Luke Harvey, reports by Alice Plunkett and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v England (Kick-off 4.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from both teams' first match of the championship, held at Aviva Stadium. Ireland are the reigning champions, but suffered their only defeat in the last two stagings of the competition when England overcame them 23-22 at Twickenham last year. Marcus Smith's last-gasp drop-goal gave his team a memorable victory, but they were unable to maintain any consistency and ended up finishing third below France, and the Irish will go into this match as favourites. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Eddie Jones, Brian O'Driscoll and Rory Best, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Ben Kay, and Gordon D'Arcy

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the remaining seven masked singers compete to avoid a double elimination and stay in the competition

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: When a personal encounter inadvertently helps Meg locate the crime scene, the detectives appear to have the evidence they need to lay charges - however, their suspects are represented by the same lawyers and they tell identical stories, except for one small change, that are all designed to hang Oscar out to dry. Max and Meg appeal to Oscar not to become a scapegoat for the Macklins, but will it be the whole truth when Oscar decides to tell them what really happened?

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Murder of Abi Fisher: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: Abi and Matthew Fisher welcomed their IVF baby into the world, but Abi was dead just six months later - now police bodycam and custody footage reveal how a West Yorkshire police investigation uncovered her killer's lies

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Leeds United v Cardiff City at Elland Road, Portsmouth v Burnley at Fratton Park and Derby County v Sheffield United in the Championship

Jekka McVicar brews some homemade 'love potions' and farmer Tom Davis demonstrates how he gets his purebred poultry competition-ready. Jaega Wise shares her favourite winter-warming beers

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: Pregnant cow Ruby gives birth but it isn't straightforward, Milo and Liz head to a local dairy farm, and the kids go into the woodland on a nature safari.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Musselburgh
programme.desc: Oli Bell presents coverage of the second day of Dublin Racing Festival from Leopardstown, including the Irish Champion Hurdle, plus four races from Musselburgh. Analysis comes from Matt Chapman and Megan Nicholls, with reporting by Sally Ann Grassick, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts as Robert Rinder, Josie Gibson and Greg Rutherford answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Jasmine Harman, Helen Lederer, Jamie Borthwick and Neil Delamere pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the remaining nine celebrities perform routines with their professional skating partners to songs that have personal meaning to them in order to impress the judges and avoid elimination

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Anton Du Beke and Fred Sirieix attempt to answer 15 questions correctly in the hope of winning one million pounds for charity. They have lifelines including Ask the Host, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: Out There
programme.desc: When Turuk arrives at the farm, Nathan confesses to killing Kenny, but Turuk knows that Johnny actually did the deed. Nathan pitches the next-door farm he's buying to Turuk as a new warehouse, but Crowther now has an eyewitness account of who burnt the car in the description of a teenage boy and two men

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: The old flame reignites between Shiv and Jack, Ant kicks Billy out as the first gang of potential house buyers arrive and Karen is in the throes of her own crisis. Shane and Caroline finally reach the limits of their love, forcing Caroline to turn to Rory for support

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: Emotions are running high on the day of the house auction - Bernie is distraught at Shiv's impending departure, Ant is depressed and Tom is sick from nerves. As the auction gets under way, Ant begins to regret his involvement and comes up with a plan to thwart the sale. Meanwhile, Caroline struggles to cope with her pregnancy alone

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell meet Sara Hathaway who, after losing her adoptive mother and older brother in the space of just a year, is desperate to find her birth family. Plus, Diane Kerridge shares her story of being forced to give up the child she gave birth to as a teenager in the 1960s. Over 50 years later, she is hoping to find her long lost son

programme.desc: Ireland v England (Kick-off 4.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from both teams' first match of the championship, held at Aviva Stadium. Ireland are the reigning champions, but suffered their only defeat in the last two stagings of the competition when England overcame them 23-22 at Twickenham last year. Marcus Smith's last-gasp drop-goal gave his team a memorable victory, but they were unable to maintain any consistency and ended up finishing third below France, and the Irish will go into this match as favourites. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Eddie Jones, Brian O'Driscoll and Rory Best, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Ben Kay, and Gordon D'Arcy

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: When a personal encounter inadvertently helps Meg locate the crime scene, the detectives appear to have the evidence they need to lay charges - however, their suspects are represented by the same lawyers and they tell identical stories, except for one small change, that are all designed to hang Oscar out to dry. Max and Meg appeal to Oscar not to become a scapegoat for the Macklins, but will it be the whole truth when Oscar decides to tell them what really happened?

programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of five races, including the Scilly Isles' Novices' Chase, from Sandown Park, plus the Irish Gold Cup at Leopardstown and action from Musselburgh. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald and Luke Harvey, reports by Alice Plunkett and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v England (Kick-off 4.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from both teams' first match of the championship, held at Aviva Stadium. Ireland are the reigning champions, but suffered their only defeat in the last two stagings of the competition when England overcame them 23-22 at Twickenham last year. Marcus Smith's last-gasp drop-goal gave his team a memorable victory, but they were unable to maintain any consistency and ended up finishing third below France, and the Irish will go into this match as favourites. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Eddie Jones, Brian O'Driscoll and Rory Best, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Ben Kay, and Gordon D'Arcy

programme.title: The Masked Singer

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: When a personal encounter inadvertently helps Meg locate the crime scene, the detectives appear to have the evidence they need to lay charges - however, their suspects are represented by the same lawyers and they tell identical stories, except for one small change, that are all designed to hang Oscar out to dry. Max and Meg appeal to Oscar not to become a scapegoat for the Macklins, but will it be the whole truth when Oscar decides to tell them what really happened?

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!

programme.title: Dream Car Fixers
